blog.title: Loki
blog.description:
(I HAVE NOT SEEN ENDGAME AND I IGNORE INFINITY WAR)

Loki Laufeyson though I would prefer Friggason instead since she truly loved and cared for me, Thor's just an oaf. Born in Jotunheim and Raised in Asgard, Lied to about my heritage as well. I am the God of Mischief, I'm quite skilled at seidr, taught by the AllMother Frigga, herself. (Message me if you want 2 rp with me, I play Loki of course) ( This a rp account if you couldn't tell along with a reblogging/posting one as well. My Major ships are FrostIron (Tony and Loki), BlackFrost (Natasha and Loki), Thorki (Thor and Loki).But I've recently checking out FrostShield (Steve and Loki) along with GammaFrost (Bruce and Loki) I was originally @Caseybelongstothehorde )

body:
Closed rp

Loki had walked into the tower and almost chuckled to himself “Please tell me, you’re going to appeal to my humanity” Thor kept trying too and it was quite funny actually. What nobody, not even Thor realized that Loki wasn’t really himself. His usual emerald green eyes were blue, maybe not as blue as the mortals were when they were under the scepter’s control but they were blue nonetheless.

Everyone believed him to be an alpha by the way he held himself and acted but he was actually an omega, he kept it hidden because he didn’t want to be treated like a prize to some bigoted alpha. Frigga had helped him hide it from everyone, spells and creams were what hidden his true nature. Unfortunately for him, the chitauri and Thanos had found out, thinking him to be weak when he proved other and he was so grateful that they didn’t force themselves on him. His heat had unfortunately started at the worse time, the moment that he got to the toward and his breeches were soaked with slick.

@techmagiclightxnshieldedsoldier

summary: i have a prompt: imagine that tony and stephen are married and Stephen is still working at the hospital when he hears that tony...
question: i have a prompt: imagine that tony and stephen are married and Stephen is still working at the hospital when he hears that tony has been in an accident and is at their hospital and dead/dying. so Stephen has a big freak out, panics, probably throws up from the nerves until christine finds him and tells him it's all fake news and that tony is okay and waiting for him. bonus points for a lot of relieved hugs and tears
answer:
For a while I didn’t know what to do with this prompt, I have to admit. But then I thought about the backstory I imagined for Fires that Burn on the Horizon, the story where Tony and Stephen have been secretly together and married for over a decade by the time Civil War comes around, and found my story there. I hope you don’t mind, Anon. 💞 And that it took me so long to get it done. (But this is the proof that eventually every prompt will get an answer! See, I can do it!)

Stephen’s “accident” (which was an assassination attempt in this ‘verse) is still in the future but it won’t be long now… *ominous thunder growls in the distance*

As is crystal clear by now I have no clue about medical stuff, which is why I have kept everything very vague. (X-ray and MRI I know from my own knee problems but that’s about it.) I prefer emotional h/c anyway, so… 😉

Title from Sting’s Why Should I Cry For You? (Listen to it, think about the future and weep as I have done.)

For All My Days Remaining

(2.841 words, AO3)

He forced his eyes open again and blinked away the tears. The moment he saw Stephen the tears were back but this time they weren’t because of the pain. “What happened?” he asked and slowly went to Stephen just as his husband came to him. They met in the middle of the office. “Stephen?” he asked again when Stephen just stared at him through wet lashes. He was trembling all over and Tony suddenly knew. It had been quite a while since Stephen’s last panic attack - in the last few years they had become Tony’s specialty, after all - but he still knew the signs by heart.

“Come here,” he said and forced the pain in his knee and back aside for the moment. He had other, more important things, to worry about now. Stephen immediately came into his offered embrace and buried his head in Tony’s neck.

“You’re here, you’re here,” he whispered over and over again and Tony swallowed hard as he tried to comfort Stephen through touch alone.

💫

summary: Was It Wrong? (my first Starker fic!!)
title: Was It Wrong? (my first Starker fic!!)
body:
Was it wrong that Peter Parker had the biggest celebrity crush on Iron Man from as far back as he could remember?  Iron Man had always been Peter’s hero.  He had Iron Man posters in his bedroom, he had an Iron Man lunch box in elementary school, he even wore Iron Man pajamas to bed at night.  He’d talk about Iron Man at school with his friends, and when they played in the playground, he liked to be Iron Man in their games.  He adored the superhero.  

He hadn’t really thought of it as a crush until he was a little bit older.  He was about thirteen when he figured out he was gay.  Actually, it was Iron Man’s fault.  And Peter wasn’t too bothered by that fact.  Who else to make you figure out you’re gay than Iron Man himself, he used to tell himself.  Or more like, the man behind the suit.  As Peter had grown from child to teen, he’d become more interested in Tony Stark the person, rather than Iron Man the superhero.  And boy, that man was everything Peter didn’t know he wanted in a man.  He had charm, good style, charisma, a dry sense of humour, and that just… flirty way about him.  Not to mention, he was HOT.  Peter wasn’t sure if it was all a show for the cameras, but he knew that either way, he was crushing on the man.  And hard. 

Something weird happened to Peter when he was fourteen.  He was bitten.  By a spider.  And strangely, he’d developed all of these amazing powers.  He used inspiration from his idol, and he used his powers to help people in need.  He wanted to be a superhero that kids would look up to, just like Iron Man was.  But selfishly, he knew a part of him was doing some of this in a desperate hope that Tony Stark would hear about him.

When Peter was fifteen, all his dreams seemed to come true.  The most unbelievable thing happened - no, really, Peter almost couldn’t believe it.  He’d just had a normal day at school, nothing special had happened, and he’d walked into his apartment to find TONY ‘the-man-I’ve-been-crushing-on-for-like-ever’ STARK sitting on the couch with Aunt May.  It took all of Peter’s strength not to freak out.  He had imagined meeting Mr Stark in a million different scenarios, but for Mr Stark to appear in his Queens apartment randomly one day…. Peter honestly thought it had been a dream.

But it turned out Mr Stark needed him for something.  Mr Tony Stark, billionaire, Iron Man himself, needed Peter.  

Was it wrong for Peter to want Mr Stark so badly?  For him to want this man who had so kindly taken him under his wing and mentored him?  For him to stare intently at Mr Stark’s lips when he was talking to him, or to imagine those lips pressed firmly against his own?  Was it wrong that Peter was lusting after his mentor?  It sure felt wrong in Peter’s mind, but he couldn’t help himself.  Every night he got off to thoughts of Mr Stark, and every morning he felt guilty as hell.  All had been fine and well crushing on Mr Stark before, but now he was a real person in Peter’s life, he couldn’t help hating himself for his feelings.

But time passed.  Peter was seventeen, and he got to spend more and more time with Mr Stark - helping with missions, learning things from him in his lab, even occasionally going out and grabbing a coffee for a casual catch-up.  He got to know Tony Stark, and not to his surprise, he learnt that the man was so much more than what he had seen in the interviews he’d watched hundreds of times on the internet when he was younger.  Tony Stark was caring, he was patient, he was reliable.  He would ask about Peter’s day and genuinely want to know the answer.  He would remember everything Peter told him, be it that he got a paper-cut at school or that he had a lead on a potential mission.  Tony Stark cared about everything Peter had to say, and he took him seriously.  Tony Stark never judged him, and he always made Peter feel as though he could never be in danger around him.

Was it wrong that Peter Parker was in love with Tony Stark?  

And he was in love.  Irrefutably.  

Was it wrong that Peter Parker was in love with a man who was thirty years older than him?

Probably.  

But the simplest moments were enough to make Peter forget all of his doubts.  Like when their hands lightly brushed together as they walked.  Like when Peter watched Mr Stark working in the lab, and he would stop every so often, glance around at Peter and smile at him.  Like when Mr Stark sent him texts at night wishing him a goodnight.  Like when Mr Stark called Peter “Mr Parker”.  And a billion more things.  Peter thought it just couldn’t be wrong.

But yet, it still was, and still would be in the eyes of the world.

More time passed, Peter fell even more hopelessly in love with Tony Stark.  He could never bring himself to tell him about his feelings in fear of ruining their relationship.  Because their relationship, in a way, was perfect.  Despite the fact that it was platonic, of course.  Peter would never want to jeopardize that.

Was it wrong that on Peter’s eighteenth birthday, Peter found himself being pushed up against the lab wall by a frantic Tony Stark?  Was it wrong that Tony Stark’s hands were all over his body, and his lips crashed against Peter’s almost desperately?  Was it wrong that Peter let himself moan against Mr Stark’s lips as the both of them gave into their greatest, but yet darkest desires?

The answer was, they’d never know.  But it felt right anyway, and for now that would do.

He hadn’t really thought of it as a crush until he was a little bit older.  He was about thirteen when he figured out he was gay.  Actually, it was Iron Man’s fault.  And Peter wasn’t too bothered by that fact.  Who else to make you figure out you’re gay than Iron Man himself, he used to tell himself.  Or more like, the man behind the suit.  As Peter had grown from child to teen, he’d become more interested in Tony Stark the person, rather than Iron Man the superhero.  And boy, that man was everything Peter didn’t know he wanted in a man.  He had charm, good style, charisma, a dry sense of humour, and that just… flirty way about him.  Not to mention, he was HOT.  Peter wasn’t sure if it was all a show for the cameras, but he knew that either way, he was crushing on the man.  And hard. 

Something weird happened to Peter when he was fourteen.  He was bitten.  By a spider.  And strangely, he’d developed all of these amazing powers.  He used inspiration from his idol, and he used his powers to help people in need.  He wanted to be a superhero that kids would look up to, just like Iron Man was.  But selfishly, he knew a part of him was doing some of this in a desperate hope that Tony Stark would hear about him.

When Peter was fifteen, all his dreams seemed to come true.  The most unbelievable thing happened - no, really, Peter almost couldn’t believe it.  He’d just had a normal day at school, nothing special had happened, and he’d walked into his apartment to find TONY ‘the-man-I’ve-been-crushing-on-for-like-ever’ STARK sitting on the couch with Aunt May.  It took all of Peter’s strength not to freak out.  He had imagined meeting Mr Stark in a million different scenarios, but for Mr Stark to appear in his Queens apartment randomly one day…. Peter honestly thought it had been a dream.

But it turned out Mr Stark needed him for something.  Mr Tony Stark, billionaire, Iron Man himself, needed Peter.  

Was it wrong for Peter to want Mr Stark so badly?  For him to want this man who had so kindly taken him under his wing and mentored him?  For him to stare intently at Mr Stark’s lips when he was talking to him, or to imagine those lips pressed firmly against his own?  Was it wrong that Peter was lusting after his mentor?  It sure felt wrong in Peter’s mind, but he couldn’t help himself.  Every night he got off to thoughts of Mr Stark, and every morning he felt guilty as hell.  All had been fine and well crushing on Mr Stark before, but now he was a real person in Peter’s life, he couldn’t help hating himself for his feelings.

But time passed.  Peter was seventeen, and he got to spend more and more time with Mr Stark - helping with missions, learning things from him in his lab, even occasionally going out and grabbing a coffee for a casual catch-up.  He got to know Tony Stark, and not to his surprise, he learnt that the man was so much more than what he had seen in the interviews he’d watched hundreds of times on the internet when he was younger.  Tony Stark was caring, he was patient, he was reliable.  He would ask about Peter’s day and genuinely want to know the answer.  He would remember everything Peter told him, be it that he got a paper-cut at school or that he had a lead on a potential mission.  Tony Stark cared about everything Peter had to say, and he took him seriously.  Tony Stark never judged him, and he always made Peter feel as though he could never be in danger around him.

Was it wrong that Peter Parker was in love with Tony Stark?  

And he was in love.  Irrefutably.  

Was it wrong that Peter Parker was in love with a man who was thirty years older than him?

Probably.  

But the simplest moments were enough to make Peter forget all of his doubts.  Like when their hands lightly brushed together as they walked.  Like when Peter watched Mr Stark working in the lab, and he would stop every so often, glance around at Peter and smile at him.  Like when Mr Stark sent him texts at night wishing him a goodnight.  Like when Mr Stark called Peter “Mr Parker”.  And a billion more things.  Peter thought it just couldn’t be wrong.

But yet, it still was, and still would be in the eyes of the world.

More time passed, Peter fell even more hopelessly in love with Tony Stark.  He could never bring himself to tell him about his feelings in fear of ruining their relationship.  Because their relationship, in a way, was perfect.  Despite the fact that it was platonic, of course.  Peter would never want to jeopardize that.

Was it wrong that on Peter’s eighteenth birthday, Peter found himself being pushed up against the lab wall by a frantic Tony Stark?  Was it wrong that Tony Stark’s hands were all over his body, and his lips crashed against Peter’s almost desperately?  Was it wrong that Peter let himself moan against Mr Stark’s lips as the both of them gave into their greatest, but yet darkest desires?

The answer was, they’d never know.  But it felt right anyway, and for now that would do.

summary: Ironstrange “I Love You” #23 - Because of a Reunion
title: Ironstrange “I Love You” #23 - Because of a Reunion
body:
“How did it go?”

Stephen asks Tony the question and waits. If it went poorly, he’s going to do something about it. The war had been won, and Steve Rogers was back on American soil. Tony and Steve had made the decision to reunite, to talk about it and to make things better - or at least as better as could be.

“It was okay,” Tony says. He crosses their living room and sits on the sofa, rubbing a hand over his eyes. “Where’s Savannah?”

“Nap time.”

“Oh,” Tony says. He yawns and then looks at the clock on the wall. “I didn’t even realize that it was nap time.”

“Things didn’t go badly?” Stephen asks. He does not want to push, but he wants the information. He wants to know if he has to drop Rogers into an alternate dimension, after all.

“No,” Tony replies. “I mean…I’m not saying it went all that well. There was yelling and…stuff. Yet, it went as well as could be expected.”

“You okay?”

“Yeah, I am okay,” Tony said, sounding almost surprised. “I think it’s time we move on. I don’t think he and I will ever look at each other the same. Or at least, I know I won’t look at him like I…yeah, you know what I mean.”

Stephen holds his hand. “I love you. I think that was incredibly brave of you, Tony.”

summary: He’s the Daddy - Tony Stark X Reader
title: He’s the Daddy - Tony Stark X Reader
body:
You stared at your reflection in the mirror, the bump was too obvious, but it was slowly growing. In the reflection behind you, you could see Tony lazily lying across the bed, watching your every movement.

“What are you doing?” he asked,
“I have to go and see him today.” even far away you could see Tony tense when you mentioned him. “I need to tell him.” Tony got off of the bed and moved to stand behind you, his hands wrapping around your stomach.
“You don’t have to. I would be a great father.” he smiled.

It had only been just over a month since you had started to date Tony. You didn’t want to tell him about the baby at first, but it came out so quickly. Tony’s reaction shocked you. He immediately took to the father role. Wanting nothing more than be a dad to your unborn child. You weren’t complaining, he treated you like a queen and protected you like one too.
“He deserves to know.” you argued softly, leaning into Tony’s muscled chest, his arc reactor glowly gently.
“I should come with you. In case he gets violent.”
“He’s never been before and I doubt he will be now. He was an asshole not an abuser.” the look on Tony’s face said he wasn’t giving up easily.
“You can wait outside in the car.” you offered the compromise. Tony slowly nodded.

You had safely made it to his house in Tony’s private car with a driver. You had stood on his porch as he answered the door and told him straight. What came next was a lot of shouting, name calling and begging for an abortion. You through a lot worse words at him and told him you were keeping it. He wasn’t needed. By the time you turned around Tony was standing next to the car, ready to run up to your side. You gave on last glare to him, you turned and walked back to Tony.
“What did he say?” Tony asked.
“He doesn’t want anything to do with it, or me.” you smiled, Tony smiled back at you and pressed a kiss to your cheek.
“Doesn’t matter. You’ve got me.”

The car ride back to the apartment was silent, you enjoyed the feeling of being in Tony’s arms, happy and contempt. One hand on your stomach and his other gently massaging your leg. You were safe here.

When you reached the apartment you noticed a crowd. It didn’t take you long to notice the cameras they each held. Tony got out first, a protective arm securely around you as you followed.
“Is it true your having a baby?” one reporter cried,
“Is is true you’re not the father of the rumoured baby?” another shouted.
“I am having a child.” he announced. “My beautiful partner had blessed me with this miracle. It does not matter whether he or she is blood. They are my family.” he pulled you into the flat, ignoring all of the other questions being fired at him.
“Tony, why did you do that?” you asked when you were safely inside.
“Because what I said it true. I don’t care if this baby is mine or not. If you’ll have me. I will look after and love you both.” he smiled, his hand gently cupping your cheek.

Tears pricked in your eyes,
“Tony.” you whispered, wrapping your arms around his chest and pulling him into a hug. “I would love that.”

tags: I didn't think this through until the end
I didn't mean for it to end so abruptly
I only had the beginning planned out
but I still think it's a good idea
summary: Buckle up, I have a big IronStrange!AU idea with A Lot of Plot™ and I will never write it in full length, so I have to share it...
body:
Buckle up, I have a big IronStrange!AU idea with A Lot of Plot™ and I will never write it in full length, so I have to share it here with you.


  • first of all, it’s not Tony who gets stabbed on Titan, but Peter
  • Stephen still trades the stone for him
  • because Peter needs to live for his plan to work
  • before the stone gets to Thanos, Stephen casts a spell with it, one he has already prepared
  • Tony fixes up Peter’s wound with his nanite goo as soon as Thanos has left the planet
  • when everyone turns to ash, Peter doesn’t
  • instead green light begins to glow around him and—zap!—suddenly he is gone
  • Tony is scared and hopeless and he wants his kid back, screaming at Stephen with tears in his eyes and completely broken
  • “Tony … there was no other way.”
  • Peter appears in a familiar place, IronSpider suit still clinging to him, a gash where Thanos has stabbed him, no mask hiding his face
  • he is thrown back to the battle at the Leipzig-Halle airport, right between the two opposing teams
  • his counterpart has vanished seconds before
  • he is younger now, he can feel it
  • the Time Stone is a weird thing
  • everyone suddenly stops running, staring at the lost looking kid in the middle of the battle field
  • “Underoos? How did you get there?”
  • Peter’s head snaps towards the confused voice and he takes everything in
  • it’s silent for several seconds, confusion lacing the air like a heavy gas
  • and then it dawns on Peter and he is jumping to his feet, gasping, trembling, his voice breaking on held back tears and sobs, his head swivelling left and right
  • he stumbles over his words, not knowing what to say, how to explain, but he knows he needs to do it fast, because the wizard sent him back to this particular moment and it’s obvious what he has to do
  • the Avengers can’t break up
  • they can’t
  • and so he blurts out the first thing that comes to mind
  • “Thanos is coming and we are all going to—to d—die, oh god, and you can’t fight, you can’t, the universe needs the Avengers to protect it, please, you can’t break up, please, pleasepleaseplease!”
  • he chokes on his words, tears rolling down his faces, sobs clogging his throat, and he is breaking apart, his lanky teenage form shaking and he is so, so scared
  • “P—Please, Mr. Stark, you have to believe me!”
  • and the adults keep staring in confusion and nobody knows what to say, because there is a child in the middle of their battle, begging them to reconcile, obviously scared out of his mind
  • Tony is the first one to react
  • his face plate flops back and reveals his worried expression
  • with hands in front of him, he slowly walks to Peter and grabs him at the shoulders, not really knowing how to calm this kid, who’s obviously drifting quickly into a panic attack
  • Peter flinches at the touch
  • but when he sees who it is, he lets go and just throws his arms around Tony, everything a bit awkward, because the suit is so bulky
  • Tony is confused
  • very confused
  • “Okay, Underoos, what’s going on?”
  • Peter stumbles over his words again, because he is scared that Cap and his friend with the metal arm will run off, like they did last time, but he needs them to stay right here, needs them to work this out, needs the Avengers to stay together
  • as fast as he can he recalls what happened, from the time he saw the spaceship, to saving the wizard, to meeting the Guardians, to fighting Thanos, to being sent back in time by the Time Stone
  • and then his mask snaps into place, making Tony’s eyes widen in surprise
  • Peter doesn’t know if he is hiding
  • he totally is
  • and the mask helps
  • when he wraps his arms around himself, he hears Tony say, “I believe you.”
  • he is so relieved that he starts to cry again, his body shaking, his knees buckling under his weight
  • Tony catches him, of course
  • and nobody leaves
  • “Why do you believe him?”
  • and Tony explains
  • because Peter is wearing a suit that Tony didn’t make and he was wearing a different one just minutes ago
  • because this suit is obviously based on nanites and Tony hasn’t had the chance to explore this kind of armour yet
  • because Thanos has been in his head since the Battle of New York
  • and because how could this kid make up something like this?
  • Peter is so relieved that Tony believes him, because he needs Tony to believe him, to help him, to set everything right
  • because, Peter knows, Tony fixes things
  • he can fix this too
  • Peter is exhausted
  • so he lets the adults talk everything out
  • they seem to come to a conclusion
  • and it doesn’t end in Cap and his friend leaving
  • Peter has to suppress a sob at this realisation
  • the Avengers will mend things between them
  • and then they will find a way to defeat Thanos
  • Peter is sure of it
  • “We need to find the wizard,” he says, because this is important and they have to find him
  • because the wizard knows more about everything that’s going on
  • Tony asks for the name
  • “He said his name is Doctor Strange, but I think that’s his made-up name, because he is a superhero, too?”
  • the mask vanishes again and shows Peter’s hopeless and scared face, big brown eyes staring at Tony, because the man will know what to do and Peter realises for the first time, since he jumped out of the bus, that he is just a child
  • and he needs an adult to make everything alright again
  • while they take the Quinjet back to New York (”Happy will get your stuff, kid”), Tony lets FRIDAY search for every Doctor Strange in the world
  • ironically she only finds one
  • when they land in New York, Peter stays at the Compound until Happy comes back in the private jet with his stuff
  • because May doesn’t expect him back so soon
  • the adults deal with the Accords and the UN and Tony is busy
  • when Peter has his stuff back, he has to go about his everyday life
  • because he is fourteen and he has to go to school and do teenage stuff and Tony would be livid if he didn’t
  • life goes on for Peter
  • but Thanos is still in his head and he worries
  • at least he already knows his stuff for classes and doesn’t have to learn so much
  • when Tony tells him he found Strange, Peter doesn’t waste any time and comes to the Compound right after school
  • together they go to Metro General Hospital
  • because Tony thinks that Peter needs to tell the story
  • when they arrive, they are directed to an office
  • but it’s not Strange’s, but one of a Doctor Christine Palmer
  • they tell her about Peter’s time travel in confidence
  • somehow she believes them
  • Christine, in turn, tells them about Stephen’s accident and how he tried to get his hands to work again
  • and how he just vanished from the face of the earth
  • “I’m sorry, Mr. Stark, but … I don’t know where he is.”
  • Peter’s shoulders slump and his throat is clogged with emotions, tears barely held at bay
  • they need to find Stephen
  • desperately
  • so Tony does everything he can and tracks his movements to Kathmandu
  • he even goes as far as to fly there himself
  • he comes back empty handed
  • it’s only when Stephen stumbles into Metro General, deathly injured, that Christine calls Tony
  • but Stephen is gone before he can make it there
  • the next time he pops up, the Ancient One dies
  • this time Tony catches him, before he can leave the hospital
  • Tony just wishes that he has the kid with him
  • but before he can talk to Stephen in length, the man brushes him off and leaves, talking about defending their reality
  • Tony has no choice but to let him go
  • portals are a nifty thing
  • they can do nothing but wait for Stephen to turn up again
  • Peter is a nervous mess, getting closer to a breakdown with each passing day
  • Tony does his best to be there for him
  • but how do you handle a kid?
  • well, he has to learn
  • which ends in a lot of Peter-Tony-Bonding
  • and general Avengers-Bonding
  • because they need to be a team again
  • and Peter is hell-bent on bullying them into it if he has to
  • he can be determined like that
  • because there are more important things than adults who can’t talk about their problems, goddammit
  • next time they see Stephen, he comes to them
  • he suddenly appears in the common area of the Compound, a sparkling portal closing behind him, cloak moving dramatically, the Eye of Agamotto around his neck
  • Peter squeaks
  • Tony flinches
  • he hates magic so much
  • everyone else just stares
  • except for Natasha, who suddenly has a knife in her hand
  • Stephen is not impressed
  • he listens to Peter’s story and believes him immediately
  • “In the last year I have seen many things that shouldn’t be possible, things nobody will believe if I told them. I have learnt magic, have fought a being from another dimension—I have manipulated time myself. Of course I believe you.”
  • Peter is relieved
  • he hugs Stephen impulsively and whispers a soft “thank you”
  • Stephen doesn’t do hugs
  • but he knows the kid needs it
  • so he doesn’t complain
  • he has grown since his accident
  • the next weeks, months, years are spent planning for Thanos’ attack
  • the UN needed to be involved
  • of course nobody outside of the Avengers knows that Peter travelled back in time
  • it’s always Spider-Man
  • with Shuri’s help they find a way to contact the Guardians
  • who want to get paid for their help
  • until Gamora shuts them up and agrees to help the heroes on earth
  • much to Rocket’s chagrin
  • “We’re all gonna die. Terrans are fucking suicidal.”
  • they also get in touch with Thor
  • Thor gets on his own mission to find as many people willing to help as possible
  • on his journey he finds Bruce and Brunnhilde
  • and Loki
  • Loki, strangely enough, wants to help
  • while the planning is going on and everyone is busy, Tony and Stephen get closer
  • Tony and Pepper never got back together
  • but they are good friends now and both happy like this
  • Stephen understands Tony better than Pepper ever could
  • and slowly, ever so slowly, they fall for each other
  • with simple, soft touches, small smiles and a lot of matching wit, snark and sass
  • it starts with Stephen spending time with Tony in his lab
  • because the others can barely keep up with their knowledge and intelligence
  • and because they simply enjoy each other’s company
  • which started off rocky
  • sometimes Peter joins them
  • but he has to keep up with school and friends and Aunt May and he really doesn’t want her to find out about his alter ego
  • not this time
  • after Thanos is done for, maybe
  • but not now
  • so they are alone most of the time
  • while Tony tinkers and Stephen uses the Time Stone to peek into the future
  • Wong strongly disapproves of this
  • it could drive Stephen insane
  • but Stephen is stubborn and refuses to budge
  • he is careful and good at what he is doing, he knows it
  • and so Wong leaves him be and returns to the Sanctum Sanctorum—he can’t leave it alone for too long
  • everyone works long and hard and tries their best
  • Vision is in Wakanda, so Shuri can work on the Mind Stone, Wanda staying with him
  • Steve is drilling everyone through training routines and strategizes with Peter, Bucky, Sam, Rhodey and Natasha, so they will have an answer to Thanos’ attacks
  • Clint and Scott spend time with their families as much as they can
  • Scott even brings in Hope and she jumps into the thick of things to help them
  • T’Challa gives Tony permission to use their vibranium to make new suits and weapons
  • Tony promises to give everything back to Wakanda, once the fight is over and Thanos is defeated
  • they get more people to help them
  • mostly people they met a few years ago, friends, family, associates
  • this includes Nick Fury
  • who gets them into touch with Carol Danvers
  • Carol takes up planning with Steve and she is a force to be reckoned with
  • and all the while Tony and Stephen start to flirt with each other, find comfort in one another
  • but they are too afraid to move any further than friendship
  • because Thanos is coming and even with Stephen looking into the future, nobody can say for sure who will survive
  • and they are too scared to lose someone else they got close to
  • so they wait, dancing around each other, flirt, touch, but never go further
  • and then Thanos sends the Black Order

  • “Tony … there was no other way.”

  • Peter appears in a familiar place, IronSpider suit still clinging to him, a gash where Thanos has stabbed him, no mask hiding his face

  • his counterpart has vanished seconds before
  • he is younger now, he can feel it
  • the Time Stone is a weird thing
  • everyone suddenly stops running, staring at the lost looking kid in the middle of the battle field
  • “Underoos? How did you get there?”
  • Peter’s head snaps towards the confused voice and he takes everything in
  • it’s silent for several seconds, confusion lacing the air like a heavy gas
  • and then it dawns on Peter and he is jumping to his feet, gasping, trembling, his voice breaking on held back tears and sobs, his head swivelling left and right
  • he stumbles over his words, not knowing what to say, how to explain, but he knows he needs to do it fast, because the wizard sent him back to this particular moment and it’s obvious what he has to do
  • the Avengers can’t break up
  • they can’t
  • and so he blurts out the first thing that comes to mind
  • “Thanos is coming and we are all going to—to d—die, oh god, and you can’t fight, you can’t, the universe needs the Avengers to protect it, please, you can’t break up, please, pleasepleaseplease!”
  • he chokes on his words, tears rolling down his faces, sobs clogging his throat, and he is breaking apart, his lanky teenage form shaking and he is so, so scared
  • “P—Please, Mr. Stark, you have to believe me!”
  • and the adults keep staring in confusion and nobody knows what to say, because there is a child in the middle of their battle, begging them to reconcile, obviously scared out of his mind
  • Tony is the first one to react
  • his face plate flops back and reveals his worried expression
  • with hands in front of him, he slowly walks to Peter and grabs him at the shoulders, not really knowing how to calm this kid, who’s obviously drifting quickly into a panic attack
  • Peter flinches at the touch
  • but when he sees who it is, he lets go and just throws his arms around Tony, everything a bit awkward, because the suit is so bulky
  • Tony is confused
  • very confused
  • “Okay, Underoos, what’s going on?”
  • Peter stumbles over his words again, because he is scared that Cap and his friend with the metal arm will run off, like they did last time, but he needs them to stay right here, needs them to work this out, needs the Avengers to stay together
  • as fast as he can he recalls what happened, from the time he saw the spaceship, to saving the wizard, to meeting the Guardians, to fighting Thanos, to being sent back in time by the Time Stone

  • Peter doesn’t know if he is hiding
  • he totally is
  • and the mask helps
  • when he wraps his arms around himself, he hears Tony say, “I believe you.”
  • he is so relieved that he starts to cry again, his body shaking, his knees buckling under his weight

Buckle up, I have a big IronStrange!AU idea with A Lot of Plot™ and I will never write it in full length, so I have to share it here with you.


  • first of all, it’s not Tony who gets stabbed on Titan, but Peter
  • Stephen still trades the stone for him
  • because Peter needs to live for his plan to work
  • before the stone gets to Thanos, Stephen casts a spell with it, one he has already prepared
  • Tony fixes up Peter’s wound with his nanite goo as soon as Thanos has left the planet
  • when everyone turns to ash, Peter doesn’t
  • instead green light begins to glow around him and—zap!—suddenly he is gone
  • Tony is scared and hopeless and he wants his kid back, screaming at Stephen with tears in his eyes and completely broken
  • “Tony … there was no other way.”

title: amor fati
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2G0MGJ5

by WTF_Starbucks_2019

– Знаешь, я ничего подобного в жизни не видел, – говорит он. – А ведь я повидал кучу всякого дерьма. Твой бойфренд проторчал во льду семьдесят лет и вышел оттуда как новенький, а от тебя не осталось ничего.

– ДЖАРВИС говорит, что я снова нагрубил, – продолжает он. – Но, если честно, мне плевать.

Баки находят. Это происходит не так, как ожидалось.
